column4: Hello. I turned off the sound option in the BIOS, the sound manager detects my sound card, I can only open a music file thru the right button and then choosing VLC -TOTEM AND RYHTMBOX won't work, not even if double click the fiele. - Why cant I hear any sound?? Yes, I checked A,LSAMIXER
well, if you turned the sound off in your bios, why would you expect it to work?
Because that't for the onboard sound, NOT the PCI Soundcard
just out of curiosity, if you enable the onboard sound, and plug in there.. does it work?
Nope. It is just strange, it was working a few days ago...
is everything set properly in Sound Preferences, to use the sound card, and not the onboard
I have even tried different combinations in the sound manager, like Analog Stereo Duplex in HARDWARE, and Analog Output/ NO Amplifier in the OUTPUT, but no,no sound at all
that seems kinda logical.. i was gonna ask if you've ruled out a hardware issue.
Well, the other strange thing is that the files wont open in TOTEM, I have to open them with right Mouse Button and choose VLC
thats not really that unusual.. right click, choose properties, click "open with"  and select totem.. just somehow your default program for music got changed
No, really, TOTEM will open, but wont play anything
i think your issue is hardware related, does your machine dual boot?
well, 9.04 wasn't LTS(I assume you mean 8.04).. i honestly don't know what could be wrong... i'd think hardware to be truthful
